sections.heading: Degree Adverbs
sections.content:
Degree adverbs express the intensity, extent, or amount of an action or quality. They answer "how much?" or "to what degree?" and modify adjectives, verbs, and other adverbs to show strength or weakness of description.

とても美味しい "Very delicious" 少し疲れた "A little tired" すごく寒い "Extremely cold"

children.heading: とても (Very)
children.content: とても美味しい "Very delicious" とても忙しい "Very busy" とても好き "Like very much" Standard "very" Polite, neutral

children.heading: すごく (Extremely/Really)
children.content: すごく美味しい "Really delicious" すごく楽しい "Extremely fun" すごく高い "Really expensive" Stronger than とても More casual

children.heading: 非常に (Extremely - Formal)
children.content: 非常に重要だ "Extremely important" 非常に危険だ "Extremely dangerous" Formal contexts Written language

children.heading: かなり (Quite/Considerably)
children.content: かなり難しい "Quite difficult" かなり疲れた "Considerably tired" かなり寒い "Quite cold" Significant degree

children.heading: めちゃくちゃ/めっちゃ (Super - Casual)
children.content: めっちゃ美味しい "Super delicious" めちゃくちゃ楽しい "Super fun" Very casual Young people Kansai origin

children.heading: 本当に (Really/Truly)
children.content: 本当に美味しい "Really delicious" 本当に嬉しい "Truly happy" 本当に分からない "Really don't understand" Emphasizes truth

children.heading: 大変 (Very/Extremely)
children.content: 大変難しい "Very difficult" 大変お世話になりました "Thank you very much" (formal) Formal emphasis Trouble/difficulty nuance

children.heading: まあまあ (So-so/Fairly)
children.content: まあまあ面白い "Fairly interesting" まあまあ美味しい "So-so delicious" Medium satisfaction Not great, not bad

children.heading: 結構 (Fairly/Quite)
children.content: 結構大きい "Fairly big" 結構好き "Quite like" 結構難しい "Fairly difficult" More than expected Considerable amount

children.heading: わりと/割と (Relatively/Fairly)
children.content: わりと簡単 "Relatively easy" 割と近い "Fairly close" Compared to expectation Moderate degree

children.heading: 少し/ちょっと (A little/Slightly)
children.content: 少し疲れた "A little tired" ちょっと寒い "Slightly cold" 少し待って "Wait a little" Small degree Softens statements

children.heading: あまり〜ない (Not very - with negative)
children.content: あまり美味しくない "Not very delicious" あまり好きじゃない "Don't like very much" あまり分からない "Don't understand well" With negative only Mild negation

children.heading: ほとんど〜ない (Hardly/Almost not)
children.content: ほとんど分からない "Hardly understand" ほとんど食べない "Hardly eat" Very little Near zero

children.heading: 全然〜ない (Not at all)
children.content: 全然分からない "Don't understand at all" 全然好きじゃない "Don't like at all" 全然面白くない "Not interesting at all" Complete negation Absolute zero

children.heading: もっと (More)
children.content: もっと速く "More fast / Faster" もっと大きい "Bigger" もっと欲しい "Want more" Increased degree Comparison

children.heading: ずっと (Much more/Far)
children.content: ずっと美味しい "Much more delicious" ずっと大きい "Much bigger" ずっと前 "Much earlier/Long ago" Significant difference

children.heading: さらに (Even more/Furthermore)
children.content: さらに難しい "Even more difficult" さらに良い "Even better" Formal addition Incremental increase

children.heading: 本当に (Really/Truly)
children.content: 本当に美味しい "Really delicious" 本当にありがとう "Thank you so much" Genuine emphasis

children.heading: 実に (Really/Indeed - Formal)
children.content: 実に素晴らしい "Really wonderful" 実に興味深い "Indeed interesting" Formal emphasis

children.heading: まったく (Completely/Totally)
children.content: まったく同じ "Exactly the same" まったく分からない "Don't understand at all" Complete degree

children.heading: ちょー/超 (Super - Casual)
children.content: ちょー楽しい "Super fun" 超美味しい "Super delicious" Young speech Very casual

children.heading: めっちゃ (Very - Casual)
children.content: めっちゃ嬉しい "So happy" めっちゃ好き "Like so much" Kansai influence Common in youth speech

children.heading: Modifying adjectives
children.content: とても大きい "Very big" すごく美味しい "Really delicious" Most common usage

children.heading: Modifying verbs
children.content: とても好き "Like very much" すごく疲れた "Got really tired" Degree of action/state

children.heading: Modifying adverbs
children.content: とても速く走る "Run very fast" すごくよく分かる "Understand really well" Layered modification

children.heading: With ない forms
children.content: あまり〜ない "not very" 全然〜ない "not at all" ほとんど〜ない "hardly" ちっとも〜ない "not at all" さっぱり〜ない "not at all" 全然分からない "Don't understand at all" Must use negative

children.heading: Before what it modifies
children.content: とても美味しい料理 "Very delicious food" すごく速く走る "Run really fast" Precedes modified element

children.heading: 〜すぎる (Too much)
children.content: 食べすぎる "Eat too much" 高すぎる "Too expensive" Excessive degree

sections.heading: Formal vs Casual Scale
sections.content: Formal: 非常に > 大変 > とても > かなり Casual: めちゃくちゃ > めっちゃ > すごく > とても Choose by context

children.heading: Using あまり with positive
children.content: Wrong: あまり美味しい ⚠️ Correct: あまり美味しくない ✓ "Not very delicious" Requires negative

children.heading: Overusing とても
children.content: Repetitive: とても、とても、とても ⚠️ Better: Vary with すごく, 本当に ✓ Vary your vocabulary

children.heading: とても vs すごく
children.content: とても: Neutral, polite "Very delicious" すごく: More casual, stronger "Really delicious" Formality level differs

children.heading: Basic
children.content: とても美味しい "Very delicious" 少し疲れた "A little tired" すごく楽しい "Really fun" かなり難しい "Quite difficult" 全然分からない "Don't understand at all" もっと欲しい "Want more"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: この料理はとても美味しいです。 少し辛いですが、すごく 気に入りました。 "This dish is very delicious. It's a little spicy, but I really like it." 昨日のテストはかなり難しかった。 全然分からない問題もあった。 もっと勉強すればよかった。 "Yesterday's test was quite difficult. There were also problems I didn't understand at all. I should have studied more." 彼女は日本語がとても上手です。 本当によく勉強しています。 私もずっと頑張らなければ ならない。 "She's very good at Japanese. She really studies well. I also must work much harder." この本は少し難しいですが、 非常に面白いです。時間を かけてゆっくり読んでいます。 "This book is a little difficult, but extremely interesting. I'm taking time to read it slowly."
